alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued December 24 at 6:24PM PST until December 25 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * CHANGES...Added Freezing Fog Advisory through late Sunday morning. * WHAT...For the Freezing Fog Advisory, visibility below 1/4 mile in freezing fog. For the High Wind Watch, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...For the Freezing Fog Advisory, until 10 AM PST Sunday. For the High Wind Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...For the High Wind Watch, damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Freezing Fog Advisory, expect hazardous driving conditions due to poor visibility and potential frost on bridges, especially along US-395 between the Hallelujah Junction and Susanville.
info.instruction: Be extra cautious if driving through the dense fog areas of northeast California tonight and Sunday morning. Use low beam headlights and fog lamps, slow down and avoid braking and making sudden turns as a thin ice layer may form on roads. This fog could also produce icy patches on sidewalks, so be aware if walking outside to reduce the risk of slipping and falling. Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.
